messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How cold does it get this Friday?
Sure—could you tell me the location you’re interested in (city or ZIP/postal code)?

No problem—I just need to know which place you’re interested in so I can look up the forecast.  
Could you share any of the following?

• The name of the city/town or its ZIP/postal code  
• Nearby landmarks or the general area (e.g., “20 mi south of Denver”)  
• A pair of latitude/longitude coordinates (even approximate ones)

Any hint about the location will let me check how cold it’s expected to get this Friday.
I really don’t have any info. Can you use your tools or something to figure out the location?

I’m sorry—I don’t have any way to discover your location on my own. To look up the temperature forecast for Friday I still need at least a rough idea of where you’re interested in (a city name, ZIP/postal code, or approximate latitude/longitude). If you can provide any hint, I’ll be happy to check the expected low temperature for you.
Ugh, I guess I don’t have enough info to find out.

Understood—it’s impossible for me to retrieve a weather forecast without knowing which spot on Earth you’re interested in. If you can think of anything that narrows it down (even “in northern Italy,” “near Toronto,” or “around latitude 40° N, longitude 75° W”), I can immediately give you Friday’s expected low.  

If you truly have no location details, here are a couple of ways you might quickly find them so we can proceed:

• Check your phone’s weather app or map app—often it shows the current city or ZIP code.  
• Look at a piece of mail, a utility bill, or a business card nearby for a city/ZIP.  
• Ask a voice assistant (“Where am I?”) or do an online “What is my ZIP code” query.  
• If you know the closest large city, even that’s enough.

Once you have even a rough idea, just let me know and I’ll pull the forecast (including how cold it will get this Friday). If you’d rather ask about something else, feel free—happy to help!
